items.headline: US Stocks Retreat on Inflation Worries and AI Jitters, Concluding a Weak February
items.summary: US equity markets experienced a notable decline at the close of the trading week on Friday, February 27, 2026, and continued to show weakness in early trading on February 28, driven by hotter-than-expected inflation data and persistent concerns surrounding the artificial intelligence (AI) sector. The S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite are set to record their steepest monthly losses since March 2025, while the Dow Jones also closed lower. Investors are actively de-risking from crowded AI and growth trades amidst valuation concerns and a murky outlook for Federal Reserve interest rate cuts.

items.statContext: Down 0.43% on Feb 27, expected to finish February down 1.43%.
Down 0.92% on Feb 27, declined 3.38% for the month.
Down 1.05% on Feb 27, ended the month little changed.

items.headline: Netflix Surges After Exiting Warner Bros. Discovery Bidding War
items.summary: Shares of Netflix ($NFLX) surged +14.03% to $XXX.XX after the company announced its withdrawal from the bidding war for Warner Bros. Discovery, opting not to overpay and poised for a significant deal breakup fee.

items.headline: Dell Technologies Rallies on Strong AI Server Demand and Buyback Plan
items.summary: Dell Technologies ($DELL) soared +21.93% to $148.08. Investors reacted positively to the company's growth forecast, driven by record AI server demand and a substantial buyback program.

items.headline: Block Jumps Following Workforce Reduction Amid AI Advances
items.summary: Block (likely $SQ) shares jumped more than +15% after the tech company announced it is cutting 40% of its workforce, attributed to advances in AI.

items.headline: Nvidia Extends Slide Amid Growing AI Investment Skepticism
items.summary: Nvidia ($NVDA) extended its post-earnings slide, dropping -4.43% to $XXX.XX. Skepticism intensified regarding the sustainability of AI capital expenditures, further impacted by OpenAI's recent $110 billion funding round.

items.headline: American Express Declines Amid Broader Financial Sector Weakness
items.summary: American Express ($AXP) fell -8.16% as financial heavyweights faced pressure, partly due to private credit contagion fears following the collapse of a UK mortgage provider.

items.headline: CoreWeave Sinks on Disappointing Guidance
items.summary: Cloud provider CoreWeave sank -18.6% after providing disappointing guidance, contributing to the overall market's cautious sentiment.

items.headline: Hotter-Than-Expected January PPI Fuels Rate Cut Delay Concerns
items.summary: The Producer Price Index (PPI) for January rose 0.5% month-on-month, exceeding economist estimates. This elevated inflation data has intensified worries that the Federal Reserve will delay interest rate cuts, impacting market sentiment negatively.

items.headline: Tech Sector Retreats as AI Valuation Concerns Mount
items.summary: The technology and communication services sectors led market declines, with chip stocks, as measured by the Philadelphia Semiconductor Index, falling 3.2%. Investors are unwinding crowded AI positions amidst concerns over high valuations and the uncertain payoff from large-scale AI spending.

items.headline: Financials Under Strain Amid Private Credit Contagion Fears
items.summary: Financial stocks experienced significant strain, with major banks and private credit firms among the biggest laggards. Concerns about potential losses in the private equity and credit markets were amplified following reports of a UK mortgage provider's collapse.

items.headline: US Treasury Yields Decline, Signaling Moderation in Fixed-Income Appeal
items.summary: The 10-year US Treasury yield has broken below the 4.00% level and is now fluctuating around 3.96%, reflecting a loss of momentum in yields and a moderation in the relative appeal of the US fixed-income market.

items.headline: HP Shares Jump Post-Earnings on Strong AI Infrastructure Demand
items.summary: HP shares jumped 12% following better-than-expected Q4 earnings, with EPS of $3.89 surpassing the $3.52 forecast and revenue reaching $33.4 billion, a 39% year-on-year increase, driven by an accelerating corporate pivot towards AI infrastructure.
